page.title: 04Religion - History
page.content: The original church was probably built about the 9th century. Only the porch remains from this date. The tower was added in the 15th century. It remains to this day. The church had to be restored in 1874 and was consecrated by the Bishop of Llandaff in 1874. The preacher was Rev. C.A. Smythies who became Bishop of Zanzibar There are six bells in the belfry. The dedication of the church is to All Saints. There have been ten vicars since 1827. The present vicar is Rev. A. Silverthorne. Mrs. Hannah Williams came from Hengoed in 1741 and started the Baptist Faith in her front room., this was probably converted to the church in 1803. The first pastor then was a Mr. Walter David.
